questions.question: A material that lets electricity pass through it is called ...
A material that does NOT let electricity pass through it is called ...
Which of the following materials is an electrical conductor?
Which of the following materials is an electrical insulator?
In which circuit will the bulb or bulbs glow brightest?

choices.answer: A simple circuit with one bulb and one battery
A simple circuit with one bulb and two batteries
A simple circuit with two bulbs and one battery
A simmple circuit with no battery

questions.question: Why is a bulb brighter when it is powered by two batteries rather than one?

choices.answer: Because the flow of electricity in the circuit is less
Because the flow of electricity in the circuit is the same
Because there is no flow of electricity
Because the flow of electricity in the circuit is greater

questions.question: You connected two bulbs and two batteries in a simple circuit. How can it be made dimmer?

choices.answer: Replace one of the batteries with a section of wire
Replace one of the batteries with a cork
Replace one of the bulbs with a section of wire

questions.question: You make a simple circuit with 1 bulb and 3 batteries. The bulb flickers & goes out. Why?

choices.answer: Not enough electricity flows around the circuit
Too much electricity flows through the bulb's filament

questions.question: Why is electrical wiring usually made from copper?
Why is electrical wiring usually covered with a layer of plastic?

choices.answer: To help electricity flow along the wire
